description: Validates ESG-specific mentions and compliance (Section 4.1). Ensures proper ESG communication based on fund classification and regulatory requirements.
regulatory_framework: French AMF regulations for fund documentation

rules.rule_text: Distinguish the fund's ESG approach according to the ESG Mapping (Engaging, Reduced, Limited to prospectus)
rules.detailed_description: Every fund must be classified into one of the ESG approach categories defined in the ESG Mapping document. This classification determines what ESG-related content can be communicated in retail documentation. The classification is mandatory and serves as the foundation for all subsequent ESG communication rules.
rules.purpose: Establishes the baseline ESG classification framework that governs all ESG communication for each fund
rules.severity_definition: Non-compliance prevents document approval and publication
rules.consequences: Document rejection, regulatory risk, potential AMF sanctions

cross_references.location: I:\service\OAM\PROCEDURES ET POLITIQUES OBAM SAS\CARTOGRAPHIE ESG
cross_references.note: Master ESG classification document maintained by OBAM
cross_references.description: Contains the official classification of all funds into ESG approach categories

rules.validation_method: Cross-reference fund identifier with ESG Mapping database to verify correct classification

rules.rule_text: Engaging approach (≥ 20% exclusion and ≥ 90% portfolio coverage) → no limit to ESG communication
rules.detailed_description: Funds classified with an 'Engaging' ESG approach have met stringent ESG criteria and are allowed unlimited ESG communication in retail documentation. This approach requires at least 20% of the investment universe to be excluded based on ESG criteria, and at least 90% of the portfolio must be covered by ESG analysis.
rules.purpose: Enables full ESG storytelling for funds with strong, demonstrable ESG commitments

quantitative_thresholds.measurement_basis: Percentage of investment universe and portfolio value

rules.consequences: None - this is a permissive rule allowing maximum flexibility
rules.validation_method: Verify fund meets threshold criteria (20% exclusion, 90% coverage) and confirm classification as 'Engaging' in ESG Mapping
common_errors: Incorrectly assuming engaging status without verification

rules.rule_text: Reduced approach → communication limited to less than 10% of the volume of the strategy presentation (measurable in number of characters if necessary)
rules.detailed_description: Funds with a 'Reduced' ESG approach must limit ESG-related communication to less than 10% of the total volume of the strategy presentation. This can be measured by character count, word count, or page space. ESG content must be proportionate and not dominate the investment narrative.
rules.purpose: Prevents over-emphasis on ESG factors for funds with limited ESG integration

quantitative_thresholds.calculation_basis: Percentage of total strategy presentation volume

rules.severity_definition: Significant violation requiring document revision before approval
rules.consequences: Document rejection, mandatory revision, potential delays in marketing materials approval
rules.validation_method: Calculate total character/word count of strategy presentation, then measure ESG-related content and verify it is below 10% threshold
rules.calculation_example: If strategy presentation = 5,000 characters, ESG content must be < 500 characters

rules.rule_text: Prospectus-limited approach → no ESG mention except in a document reserved for a professional institutional investor
rules.detailed_description: Funds classified as 'Prospectus-limited' approach must not include any ESG mentions in retail client documentation. ESG information can only appear in the regulatory prospectus and in documents specifically prepared for professional institutional investors. This is the most restrictive ESG communication category.
rules.purpose: Prevents misleading retail investors about funds with minimal or no ESG integration

exceptions.rationale: Professional investors can assess ESG information with appropriate expertise

rules.severity_definition: Absolute prohibition - any violation is a critical compliance breach
rules.consequences: Immediate document rejection, regulatory breach, potential AMF investigation, reputational risk
rules.validation_method: Scan entire document for any ESG-related keywords, terms, or references. Flag any occurrence as violation.

rules.rule_text: Other funds → no ESG mention, except mention of OBAM common baseline exclusions
rules.detailed_description: Funds that do not fall into the Engaging, Reduced, or Prospectus-limited categories (classified as 'Other funds') must not include ESG mentions in retail documentation. The only permitted exception is mentioning the OBAM common baseline exclusions policy that applies to all funds managed by OBAM.
rules.purpose: Maintains consistency in ESG communication while allowing disclosure of firm-wide exclusion policies

exclusion_types: Controversial weapons (cluster munitions, anti-personnel mines, chemical weapons, biological weapons)
Other firm-wide exclusions per OBAM policy
exceptions.rationale: Common baseline exclusions are firm policy, not fund-specific ESG strategy

rules.consequences: Document rejection, mandatory revision to remove unauthorized ESG content

cross_references.description: Defines the firm-wide exclusions applicable to all OBAM funds

rules.validation_method: Verify no ESG content exists except for specific mention of OBAM baseline exclusions
permitted_phrasing_examples: OBAM applies a common exclusion policy to all funds
This fund is subject to OBAM's firm-wide exclusions including controversial weapons
Exclusions apply in accordance with OBAM's responsible investment policy

rules.rule_text: ESG rules apply excluding professional funds
rules.detailed_description: All ESG communication rules in this section apply only to retail client documentation. Professional funds (funds reserved for professional investors) are exempt from these restrictions. Professional investors are deemed to have sufficient expertise to evaluate ESG information independently.
rules.purpose: Clarifies scope of ESG communication restrictions and professional investor exemption

characteristics: Reserved for professional investors per MiFID II
professional_fund_definition.regulatory_basis: MiFID II professional client categorization, French AMF regulations

rules.consequences: None - clarifies which funds are subject to ESG rules

cross_references.description: Defines criteria for professional investor status

rules.validation_method: Verify fund classification (retail vs professional) before applying ESG communication rules
rules.exemption_rationale: Professional investors have resources, expertise, and regulatory protections that reduce need for prescriptive ESG communication rules
common_errors: Applying retail rules to professional funds

esg_approaches.name: Engaging
esg_approaches.description: Strong ESG integration with ≥20% exclusion and ≥90% portfolio coverage

esg_approaches.name: Reduced
esg_approaches.description: Limited ESG integration with basic ESG considerations

esg_approaches.name: Prospectus-Limited
esg_approaches.communication_level: No ESG mention in retail documents

esg_approaches.name: Other
esg_approaches.description: Funds not classified in above categories
typical_fund_types: Standard funds with firm-wide exclusions only

key_terms_glossary.ESG: Environmental, Social, and Governance factors in investment decisions
key_terms_glossary.Exclusion rate: Percentage of investment universe excluded based on ESG criteria
key_terms_glossary.Portfolio coverage: Percentage of portfolio assets subject to ESG analysis
key_terms_glossary.AMF: Autorité des Marchés Financiers (French financial markets regulator)
key_terms_glossary.Professional investor: Investor meeting MiFID II professional client criteria
key_terms_glossary.Baseline exclusions: Firm-wide exclusion policy applied to all funds

validation_workflow.step_1: Identify fund and retrieve ESG classification from ESG Mapping
validation_workflow.step_2: Identify target client type (retail vs professional)
validation_workflow.step_4: Apply relevant ESG rules based on classification
validation_workflow.step_5: Validate content against specific rule requirements
validation_workflow.step_6: Flag violations with appropriate severity level
validation_workflow.step_7: Generate compliance report with remediation guidance

use_cases: Validating ESG content in fund factsheets
Reviewing marketing materials for ESG compliance
Classifying new funds in ESG framework
Training compliance teams on ESG rules
Auditing existing documentation for ESG violations
common_queries: What can I say about ESG for this fund?
How much ESG content is allowed?
What are the ESG communication limits?
Do ESG rules apply to professional funds?
